page.title: 01OUR SURVEY AREA
page.content: Our block is in North_east Essex sometimes called the Tendring Peninsula about 3 miles from the coast. The nearest town is Clacton_ on_Sea. Half of Little Clacton village and a little of Thorpe_le_Soken come into our area,otherwise it is mainly farm_ land with one or two small woods. A large part of the housing is mainly two bedroomed bungalows and being close to the sea, more than 32% of it is occupied by retired people. At Thorpe Cross we have some large gravel workings but apart from farming, the only industry is the Maltings by Thorpe Station employing five people. Because of this, people have to travel either to Clacton or Colchester to work. Quite a large number also commute to London each day.
